subject: Art & Design
title: Christian Dior's New Look: Post-War Glamour
description: A fast breakdown of Christian Dior's New Look: Post-War Glamour for builders.

hook.text: In 1947, Christian Dior used 20 yards of fabric for one skirt. Post-war fabric was rationed.

buildup.text: The 'New Look' featured nipped waists, padded hips, full skirts, and rounded shoulders.

discovery.text: Women had worn practical, fabric-saving styles during WWII.

twist.text: Feminists protested: the New Look put women back in restrictive silhouettes. Liberation through fashion went backward.

climax.text: Despite controversy, it dominated fashion for a decade and established Paris as the global fashion capital again.

punchline.text: The New Look wasn't just about clothes.

quiz.question: Why was Dior's New Look controversial?
options: It used excessive fabric during rationing and put women back in restrictive silhouettes
It was too similar to pre-war fashion
